text: The Henry and Elizabeth Adkinson Evans House is a historic residence located south of Winterset, Iowa, United States. Henry Evans settled in the Madison County with his mother when he was 14. He farmed of her land and then inherited when she died in 1875. He opened a quarry, cut the stone, and built this house in 1885. It was the last house that was built of quarried native limestone constructed by local builders. with The house is a square, two- story structure that is composed of ashlar stone, and capped with a hip roof. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. ==References== Category:Houses completed in 1885 Category:Vernacular architecture in Iowa Category:Houses in Madison County, Iowa Category:National Register of Historic Places in Madison County, Iowa Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Iowa
title: Henry and Elizabeth Adkinson Evans House
